     a good rule of dog-naming i go by, always meet the dog before giving it a name. otherwise the dog will probably be named incorrectly

10.22.19  4:23 pm   why don't you use lower case letters

     usually for an acronym, or chord symbols, or sometimes at the beginning of a sentence for a decisive tone shift. or for signage. jeez there must be 100 reasons. how about to give a grade, if you really want to give someone that A+ they've been craving

     i've known the whole time. i find it pretty obvious

10.22.19  3:14 pm   Most memorable dream?

     probably the one i'm in right now

10.22.19  2:45 pm   how many millipedes are there

     just one, but it's in many pieces, which are all still alive

10.22.19  2:38 pm   I sometimes make music for my animations, but I have no formal training in anything remotely musical, and a lot of my songs end up sounding the same. How do I add more variety to my songs? 

     if making a song different does not make it different enough, try to actually make it not a song. it may end up being a song anyway, but at least you may have got a head start on the differentness by attempting to throw it out of its category entirely. it's like the old fairy tale, if you want to get a mouse to go to a different room, throw the mouse out of the house entirely, and it will still come back but it might come back to a different room

10.22.19  2:36 pm   Why do I like when people to stay real

     real is stronger, more powerful. like a story that writes itself

      and why I have lots of philosophy about life but still I am worthless?

     there is no way to measure the worth of a person. i'm afraid to say, if you have a person worth measuring system, you might have to return it because those things are fake

      and you are awesome!

     i am normal

10.22.19  2:28 pm   pancakes or muffins

     i am holding out for the muffcake to be invented

10.22.19  2:27 pm   How much does a horse cost to make?

     if you actually make the damn thing it won't cost you anything. but if you are buying the parts and assembling it then you are looking at about 29000 lyre per part and if you are paying someone else to do it then that's 1200 more for labor, unless you get another horse to do it, which is advisable because not only do they know how to do it extremely well, but also you don't have to pay them because they don't like money. but you do have to give them a basket to poop in. hope that helps

10.22.19  2:23 pm   what would you say are the primary creative inspirations that you feel have contributed to your art style the most?

     abiogenesis, and the ridiculous series of events that has unfolded as a result

10.22.19  2:19 pm   What gave you the idea for alphabet shuffle?

     the alphabet

10.22.19  1:47 pm   10.20.19  5:55 pm   Thanks for the tips, Bill!  I'm currently having some fun writing my song and it may be up on YouTube soon, but I haven't decided the length. Would 7 or 8 seconds work? Or does it need to be 2 seconds? Thanks!
-Misha

     you can try 7 or 8, but, if you are still feeling overwhelmed, don't forget that you always have the option of actually dialing it back to 1 second. the advantages here are ridiculous. you will finish it very quickly, freeing up time to do 3, 4, 5 second or more. you learn things every time you finish a song, so 1 second means almost instantaneous learning. if you are feeling frozen like you can't do anything and you're confused and can't learn anything, just try something shorter. eventually you will go from learning nothing to learning everything, extremely quickly. and then increase the length from there. it's like going up a staircase. very easy, if you actually start at the bottom

10.22.19  1:43 pm   do you think glenn gould's dislike for audiences came from a dislike of culture in general?

     no

10.22.19  1:12 pm   what are you going to be for halloween?

     i'm wondering what halloween is going to be

10.22.19  12:27 pm   got any uses for convolution neural networks?

     yes please

10.22.19  11:44 am   would you be open to releasing a video of yourself being crazy efficient on all your keyboards?

     yes but there would be other stuff in the video too. the thing we must not forget is what gives keyboards their power is their influence over non-keyboards

10.22.19  11:16 am   what do you think my question is

     what do you think my question is

10.22.19  11:01 am   Are you taking a break from literally everything but the questions page or something

     no, i'm learning to do new things

10.22.19  10:20 am   On a scale of 1-10, how much meaning do your songs actually have

     10

10.22.19  7:11 am   hey bill, are there any instrumental versions of your songs anywhere? i was thinking of doing covers of them (and crediting you of course)

     i think, forgive me if i'm wrong, but doing a cover of a song means you have to actually do the music and sing it. i think what you are talking about is karaoke

10.22.19  5:52 am   can i add a wireless keyboard to keyboard maestro as a macro controller? how do i do this so the keyboard won't actually press that key as a main keyboard?
i am running out of combinations on my trusty old butterfly keyboard. pls help.

     ok, 2 very important things i have to say about this. 1, yes, you can absolutely use additional keyboards with kbm, all with their own separate keys. i'm currently using 9 keyboards. i will explain the trick i discovered for doing that. but the other important thing i must tell you first is that if you start including wireless keyboards in your setup, you will be in agony city. i had 3 wireless keyboards in the setup and it was a disaster. it's occasionally annoying when a bluetooth keyboard disconnects, but if you have 4 bluetooth keyboards it's going to happen 4 times more often. actually more, because bluetooth just gets messed up when you have too many. i returned all the wireless keyboards and went for wired keyboards only. much more reliable. Ok, now that that hint/tip is out of the way, the secret for getting additional keyboards in kbm is first get Karabiner Elements (this is a key-swapping software). But instead of swapping keys, you are actually going to disable every key. (set it to "vk disable".) this may take a while if you go through the popup menus, but if you open the json file you can change it via the text all in one shot (with a little help from kbm of course). Once you have all the keys disabled, go into keyboard maestro and when you make your trigger, instead of "Hot Key" trigger, use "USB device key" trigger, press a button and it will come right up. This works for almost any keyboard you can imagine, even PC keyboards (although you may never get the function key.) Another secret tip that i will tell you is, if extra keyboards don't work when you first try, or if they don't work when you first boot up, just put the computer to sleep then wake it up. quickest way is to go to the lock screen and then unlock (and i've now zapped that with a macro). only have to do it if i restart, otherwise they work forever. it took me a while to figure that out, i thought they mysteriously just didn't work until i went to lunch. email me if you need any more tips, i have learned a lot so far, and it's a strange world, and i've run into a lot of things i didn't expect, but overall it's been much easier than i expected, considering what i've seen Tom Scott and Taran Van Hemert had to go through. and i'm not even sure if peternlewis is even aware that what i'm doing is possible

10.22.19  5:44 am   do you know that you have a massive influence on famous ppl?

     it's only fair, i'm sure famous people have had plenty of influence on me. influence the influencers, that's what i say

10.22.19  5:42 am   what if i just believe that the traumatic things that happened to me just didn't happen and that my memories of it are actually just me remembering a movie about someone else experiencing them?

     that's pretty good. maybe write some more movies to supplement and contrast with it

     due to its large size

10.22.19  3:11 am   do you include the vocalizations when you write your lyrics 

     as far as i know, lyrics are upwards of 100% vocal. if you write lyrics, you're writing vocals. *bruce hornsby voice* that's just the way it is

10.22.19  1:21 am   im happy that you're still answering questions least. did you actually decide to quit or would you just consider this an extended sabbatical?

     neither. what i have really decided to do is start, in a much broader and more large way than previously ever conceived. this may take a bit of time, lord knows it took ages last time

     yes
